item.title: About
item.description: I am a tunnel ventilation engineer with a research background in fluid mechanics. As a doctoral researcher at the University of Oxford, I modelled the effects of realistic ocean conditions on tidal energy devices. I subsequently joined Atkins where I was involved in several major tunnel ventilation projects in the UK, USA and Middle East. I have been a member of the SNC-Lavalin tunnel ventilation team since early 2017, and have been working on the ongoing Eglinton Crosstown LRT and Confederation Line LRT as well as smaller consulting projects.

item.title: Publications & Talks
item.description: Publications M Duckham, K Brown and C F Fleming (2017) ‘Integration of tunnel ventilation and train control systems’, in Proc. 17th Int. Symp. on Aerodynamics, Ventilation & Fire in Tunnels, Lyon, France Y S Shi, C F Fleming, C Sejekan, E Wong, M Samimi and M Duckham (2017) ‘Automated coupling of standard one-dimensional and three-dimensional flow solvers for simulation of metro ventilation systems’, in Proc. 17th Int. Symp. on Aerodynamics, Ventilation & Fire in Tunnels, Lyon, France C F Fleming, G T Clark, K R Meeks and T Wicht (2016) ‘The treatment of the throttling effect in incompressible 1D flow solvers’ in Proc.
